chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
s: chain T

Goal:
proj2_chain diag_chain = s

Premises:
diag_chain = [fun x : T => (x, x)^^sbydiag_mono] : chain (pairPoset T T)
proj2_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T2
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
proj1_diagE = (fun _evar_0_ : [fst \o (fun x : T => (x, x))^^sbycomp_mono proj1_mono diag_mono] = s => eq_ind_r (eq^~ s) _evar_0_ (comp_chainE s proj1_mono diag_mono)) ((fun _evar_0_ : s = s => eq_ind_r (eq^~ s) _evar_0_ (id_chainE s (comp_mono proj1_mono diag_mono))) (erefl s)) : proj1_chain diag_chain = s
id_chainE : forall (T : poset) (s : chain T) (M : monotone id), [id^^sbyM] = s
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s : chain T |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s : chain T |- poset]
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s : chain T |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s : chain T |- ?A -> poset]
cat_take_drop : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), take n0 s ++ drop n0 s = s
cats0 : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), s ++ [::] = s
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
proj1_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain [posetofT1 * T2] -> chain T1
chainE : forall (T : poset) (s1 s2 : chain T), s1 = s2 < -> s1 =p s2
const_chainE : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (s : chain T1), [fun=> y^^sbyconst_mono] = const_chain y
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
nth_take : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (x0 : T) (i : nat), i < n0 -> forall s : seq T, nth x0 (take n0 s) i = nth x0 s i
const_chain : forall T2 : poset, T2 -> chain T2
pred_of : forall T : poset, chain T -> Pred T
drop = fun T : Type => fix drop (n : nat) (s : seq T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => s | _ :: s' => match n with | 0 => s | n'.+1 => drop n' s' end end : forall T : Type, nat -> seq T -> seq T Arguments drop {T}%type_scope _%nat_scope _%seq_scope
size_take : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), size (take n0 s) = (if n0 < size s then n0 else size s)
Chain : forall (T : poset) (pred_of : Pred T), chain_axiom pred_of -> chain T
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
comp_chainE : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (s : chain T3) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2), [f1^^[f2^^sbyM2]byM1] = [f1 \o f2^^sbycomp_mono M1 M2]
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
Mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) => nosimpl (let '@PropPredType _ Pred_Sort0 toPred s as pT0 := pT return (pT0 -> Mem_Pred T) in let '@exist _ _ mem _ as s0 := s return (PropPredType s0 -> Mem_Pred T) in mem) : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T), pT -> Mem_Pred T Arguments Mem {T}%type_scope {pT}
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0 | _ :: s' => (size s').+1 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Arguments size {T}%type_scope _%seq_scope
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Arguments head {T}%type_scope _ _%seq_scope
take = fun T : Type => fix take (n : nat) (s : seq T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => match n with | 0 => [::] | n'.+1 => x :: take n' s' end end : forall T : Type, nat -> seq T -> seq T Arguments take {T}%type_scope _%nat_scope _%seq_scope
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0 => x | n'.+1 => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Arguments nth {T}%type_scope _ _%seq_scope _%nat_scope
BinNat.N.eq_add_1 : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.add n m = BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH -> n = BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH /\ m = BinNums.N0 \/ n = BinNums.N0 /\ m = BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH
BinNat.N.eq_add_0 : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.add n m = BinNums.N0 < -> n = BinNums.N0 /\ m = BinNums.N0
BinInt.Z.eq_mul_0 : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n m = BinNums.Z0 < -> n = BinNums.Z0 \/ m = BinNums.Z0
BinNat.N.one_succ = erefl (BinNat.N.succ BinNums.N0) : BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH = BinNat.N.succ BinNums.N0
